title: 111_s3990
content: The Act titled "Emergency Unemployment Benefits Extension Act of 2010" extends unemployment insurance provisions. The Emergency Unemployment Benefits Extension Act of 2010 extends unemployment insurance provisions by amending various dates in existing legislation. The Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2008 is amended to change the date from April 30, 2011, to June 10, 2012. Funding provisions are also amended to include the Emergency Unemployment Benefits Extension Act of 2010. These amendments are effective as if included in the enactment of the Unemployment Compensation Extension Act of 2010. Temporary modification of indicators under the Extended Benefit Program. The Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970 is amended to allow states to adjust indicators for extended benefit periods. The modification includes changing the word 'two' to 'three' in certain subparagraphs. The Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970 is amended to allow states to adjust indicators for extended benefit periods. The amendment includes changing certain numerical values in the determination process. SEC. 4. RESCISSION OF UNSPENT FEDERAL FUNDS TO OFFSET LOSS IN REVENUES. $95 billion in unobligated discretionary funds are permanently rescinded. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget will determine which accounts the rescission applies to. Exceptions are made for the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs. SEC. 5. BUDGETARY PROVISIONS. The budgetary effects of this Act will be determined by reference to the latest statement titled `Budgetary Effects of PAYGO Legislation' jointly submitted for printing in the Congressional Record by the Chairmen of the House and Senate Budget Committees.
